author: Staff Reporter
text:
The second phase of the intensified pulse polio immunisation campaign will be held on February 21.

The Health Department is aiming to immunise a total of 3,96,786 children aged 0 to 5 years in Vellore district.

The first round of the campaign was conducted on January 17. The department has made arrangements to administer the drops to children through 2,393 booths.

Such booths will also be set up at the toll plazas on the National Highway, bus terminals and railway stations, a press release said.

In addition, booths are being provided for areas with poor transport connectivity such as hilly terrains.

The department will also reach out to children of migrant labourers, including those involved in construction work, road expansion works and those selling dolls, through special camps.

Special camp will also be arranged for children of Sri Lankan Tamil refugees residing in the district. To carry out the work, 9,466 persons, including staff of Public Health, Education, Social Welfare and Revenue departments, NGOs and women Self Help Groups would be involved in the campaign. Another 290 supervisors have also been involved.

The Health Department has made arrangements to receive adequate stock of drops for the second phase of the campaign. Officials have stressed the need for children aged 0 to 5 years to receive the drops on February 21 irrespective of previous doses.

They have urged parents to bring the children to the booths to get immunised against polio for a polio-free society, the release said.

title: Second phase of polio drive on February 21
